website_summaries.verdict: An effective, entry-level dust collector with a capacity that would suit most small home shops.
cons: Smaller capacity is not enough for some shops
No separate section in the bag for chip collecting

customer_reviews.title: Insuffient suction
customer_reviews.text: The product was received in a timely fashion and there was no outward appearance of any damage whatsoever. However I have been dealing with it since July and it just doesn't provide any suction. My run to the table saw is not more than 2 foot and still insufficient. To test my piping I hooked up a small 24 year old shop vac to my piping and it provided plenty of suction. I am going to call today to see if I can get any service from the seller and if not I will just keep using the old shop vac and cast this off to a bad choice.
customer_reviews.author: Reno72

customer_reviews.title: if There is a 100 character limit tell me st the outset!  This is an excellent unit
customer_reviews.text: I use the product on my 10” table saw. The saw is made with a dust extraction system but uses a 2.25” diameter pipe which reduces the efficiency of the 4” Shop Fox. I use the saw/dust collector combo with a wireless remote. I mounted the switch directly beside the saw on/off switch so that I can start the vac before the saw. By the time I direct my attention back to the saw the vac is up to speed and ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit with a Small Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up to my 8 inch Shop Fox jointer because my central dust collection system wasn't doing the job. It fixed the problem. The only flaw I can find so far is that the spring band clamp intended to hold the bag on the unit just plain doesn't work. It isn't big enough. I replaced it with a regular 5 inch band clamp and the problem was solved. There is no excuse for this.
customer_reviews.author: Wight Mann

customer_reviews.title: Good for a single tool.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a table saw and anything else I could run up to it. Found it’s only really useful for one tool with a short-ish run, <10 feet. A 20 foor hose gets a lot less suction. It works great for my table saw. Other cons: it looses the vast majority of suction when the bag is about 1/2 - 2/3 full. The band clamp that holds the bag onto the unit is nearly useless. I cut my hand trying to set it up. I later got a 6” hose clamp that’s 100x better.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: The output is not 4", which might matter to you.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, it does a great job. I'm reviewing only to let you know that the output is NOT 4". The output is 5". If you are looking for an inline air-mover (like to remove cellulose insulation from an attic), you will need an adapter such as a Fernco Inc. P1002-44 which is a literal 5" to 4" coupling. Ignore the nominal size markings on that adapter, it is pretty much 5x4 and makes the output more useful and I will confirm that it fits. Or, you can always go the duct tape route.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't have it...
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say that this is not the product that I thought it to be. Had connected to my cyclone dust collector and it barely has any suction power. Not too sure as to why this is but I don't think this would even be enough for one tool. I'm not going to bad mouth it or anything but what I have read online compared to the results in my shop are two different things. Guess I'm back to the shop vac and cyclone dust collector. Save your money for something stronger folks.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Could be designed better
customer_reviews.text: Once connected to the CNC it really pulls well but after a few hours cut I realized that the inlet was totally clogged with wood and had to disassemble the connection at the machine and with pliers clear out the hose and inside the machine. I ended up cutting out the grate they installed on the inlet. A few hours later it was clogged again as there was another grate on the outlet that was now clogged. Once those 2 were removed it has been running like a champ even on 10hr jobs. I also drilled a static line mount into the inlet and ran it inside the dust hose to prevent static.
customer_reviews.author: annonimouse

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine for the money. I plumbed a system together that handles my saws, sanders, planers, and hand power tools just fine. A centrifugal pre-filter is an absolute must for this machine. I bought a Dust Deputy 5" inlet with a 20 gallon can, and put together a great system for hundreds less than I would have spent for a similar ready-to-go system.
customer_reviews.author: C. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Great small shop accessory
customer_reviews.text: For a small shop, this product is great! I have it hooked up through a home-made cyclone separator and the suction didn't reduce by much. At first I had a shop vac fixture on the separator so I got a reducer. That all but stopped the suction completely, so I cut it out and put a 4 inch connection. Works perfectly. I was kind of surprised at how quiet this runs. Sounds about the same as a garbage disposal. Got a used one and had to take a dent out of the motor casing... took all of 2 minutes. All in all, I'd say get 4 inch connections only, and use on 1 tool at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Probably better out there
customer_reviews.text: A great idea that lacked a designer! The clip that comes is a tad too short and makes for a torturous time attaching the dust bag to the motors neck that is also too short!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Farmery

customer_reviews.title: Not the CFM I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would be able to replace the China Freight, 2-bag dust collector I had. I hate changing bags on those collectors. I was hoping the CFM rating it had would make it work for my CNC machine. Nope. I'm going to have to re-plump my air flow system from flex hose to 4" metal piping. Wasn't a task I really wanted. Oh well.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth wasting time with this light weight .
customer_reviews.text: This dust collector is nice looking easy to install on the wall and has no power I had to go back to using my old shop vacuum. Now the noise level in the small shop is less then the powerless dust collector. I have only one lathe on the in take of the collector which can’t even suck the dust and small shavings.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne E  Renfrow

customer_reviews.title: Its wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This product, together with a dust shoe on my cnc sucks up almost all the dust that my cnc makes. Its wonderful! Before having this, I would spend hours sweeping the garage after each cnc project. Now my wifes car, which parks next to the cnc, stays perfectly clean! I will say, it is quite loud, but so is my CNC so it makes no difference for me. Also, I am not sure how loud other dust collectors are, so for all I know this one could be quiet.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: All around great collector.
customer_reviews.text: It's a little louder than my old bucktool 1hp but it does have 250cfm more than it had. Handles 4 drops very well. I have it running through a homemade cyclonic separator. Has a slight rattle sound which is a little concerning. We'll see how it holds up. I'll update my review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: fantastic product, would highly recommend to anyone. See the attached picture of it in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I run only a few small job site saw, router table and a sanding table within a small area of about 12 X 8 shop. works well for that but a larger shop you will need a much bigger machine. But for the hobby work that wants to use it on a mobile base or hang on the wall with no more that three dust gates it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Warren

customer_reviews.title: Like an ex-wife.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks better than my ex-wife at a matress behind the YMCA. The noise is loud and constant like her too.
customer_reviews.author: E Rock

customer_reviews.title: Um, it sucks.  But it doesn't suck enough.  which means, it kinda sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah... I reviewed this with less than 3 mos of service. I had one machine hooked up, and I hadn't yet employed a tornado trash barrel lid. The unit is now insufficient for my needs in my fairly small 400 sq ft shop. Ymmv, based on what you're doing. I still love that it's wall mounted and out of the way, but making it a robust collector of all dust at all times is a challenge, if not impossible. Set up, including to conversion to 240v, all went smoothly. The collector works great and keeps my shop clean. I'm working on hooking up all my tools now; thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Too small for most uses. I recommend a bigger hp unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with me dealt planer. I added an Oneida super cycle dust collector with a 4” metal duct. I made the mistake in adding a wye connection. Suction was insufficient so I removed the wye. Now works without a problem. I wish I bought the 2 hp unit. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solidly built unit. I used this as a suction unit for my shop dust collection system as you can see from the photo. It is rated a little over 500cfm and manages to draw about 30 feet of 4" pvc pipe with blast gates and a single tool running at a time. It is noisy however so I don't run it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: metalcaster

customer_reviews.title: This collector so far has been great. Far more suction than I ever believed it ...
customer_reviews.text: This collector so far has been great. Far more suction than I ever believed it would have. I have three machines attached to the unit with blast gates etc. and over 20' in length with no noticeable difference in suction at the furthest location. One thing I would suggest when attaching the mounting bracket is to tap out the holes that the bolts go into before trying to bolt it on. Paint build-up etc. make it very difficult to get the bolts started. Other than that small issue I am pleased with the collector.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Used for Air Coffee Roaster - Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great little collector. I used it for my coffee roaster, to pull the smoke and chaff out of the building. Great little workhorse, even with all of the chaff and smoke residue built up inside it, it never gave me any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Null Pointer Expert

customer_reviews.title: Not enough suction
customer_reviews.text: The product came well boxed in a timely manner I mounted it on the wall.I hooked it up to my Cutech planer and ran a few boards through it just doesn’t have enough suction! I have an old craftsman shop vac that has more suction on this thing. Not very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good unit for short runs
customer_reviews.text: Good unit for short runs, but lacks power for anything over 10' away. Wish I would of done more research.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Simon II

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Purchased back in 2016 and I have used it everyday since. Mon thru Fri 8 to 10 hour a day. I have it hooked up to auto dust ports so it only turns on as tools are used.. It has been a work horse. I probably will get another year or so of life left in it . Not bad for $220 investment.
customer_reviews.author: rugas

customer_reviews.title: Shopfox dust collector
customer_reviews.text: It's a good unit. Not really a powerhouse but most dust collector of this design are not. I does the job in a small shop using 1 tool at a time. What I like most is it quieter than most I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Chet

customer_reviews.title: Works but lacks quality control. See photo.
customer_reviews.text: Unit works and is reasonable quite so I'm keeping it but it arrived damaged. Shipping box and packaging we not damaged but the blower had a dent in the output port and the paint job is so bad a huge maybe 4 inch x 4 inch piece is not bonded to metal at all and about to fall off. Damage must have happened before it was boxed at the factory but it still made it out the door. I will look at other brands in the future.
customer_reviews.author: mrazekkarel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks !. Ha, ha. It works great for my tool use.(one tool at a time, no "duct" system) It's small, compact and looks good compared to those big huge ugly dust collectors. It just hangs there in the corner and does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Paull

customer_reviews.title: Works Good!
customer_reviews.text: Quieter than thought it would be. Took a star because fan shroud was bent like so many others have posted. Easily fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Conrod

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction for a 1hp
customer_reviews.text: Excellent deal strong suction , issuing it at 220v is 3.5amp only , saving lots of electricity
customer_reviews.author: Carlos K

customer_reviews.title: Modest suction
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my shop-vac, the noise level was a joy. I reduced it's inlet from 4" to 2.5" and found the suction to be too modest. It did pick up table saw and band saw debris but could not handle debris from my thickness planer. I guess barely adequate would be my best description.
customer_reviews.author: mike huntley

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even pull the dust from the hose attached to a table saw.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in Feb 2020. Runs about 10 minutes, motor reaches 220deg then shuts off. Shop fox sent capacitor but it did the same thing. I'll probably get a new motor in time but this vacuum doesn't have half the suction that a regular shop-vac has.
customer_reviews.author: john birkhead

customer_reviews.title: shop fox
customer_reviews.text: one of the best things i have bought for my shop
customer_reviews.author: Brock Coltrain

customer_reviews.title: Great suction but bag system is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works REALLY well. I only gave 4 stars because the clamp that holds the bag is almost impossible to put on and keeps falling off. Really poorly designed. I don’t get it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vacanti

customer_reviews.title: Fairly quiet and good suction. Have used it with my planer mostly ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had this dust collector for about 18 months now. Fairly quiet and good suction. Have used it with my planer mostly but am going to be building a workshop so I intend to buy a second one. That way I can cover each side of the shop with a separate unit.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Moraga

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. Hooked up to my DeWalt DW735 and has plenty of suction with 20 feet of hose.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It's been working like a champ for 2 years now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Works great powerful
customer_reviews.text: It's gray little dust collection unit fitswell on the wall
customer_reviews.author: kevin brown

customer_reviews.title: well made.
customer_reviews.text: just what I need for dedicated dust collection on my lathe
customer_reviews.author: Robert O.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered two of these and agree that the packaging ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these and agree that the packaging was inadequate. That being said, both of mine arrived with no visible damage to the units, however, the impeller fan on both was installed off-kilter and struck the housing when activated, damaging the housing. I called Woodworking International (the manufacturer) and they requested that I take off the impeller fan and reseat the motor. The impeller fan bolt was on so tight that I couldn't get it off. I returned both of them and reported that they have a quality control issue. Two in a row? Come on!
customer_reviews.author: Warren Elmblad

customer_reviews.title: A nice unit. Ran it with pvc 3 inch pipe ...
customer_reviews.text: A nice unit. Ran it with pvc 3 inch pipe with copper wire inside for static control. Good unit and big space saver. It sucks lol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good dust collection
customer_reviews.text: I do tons of sanding with 40 grit paper spinning at 3500 rpm. I installed this DC and piped it in with 4 s&d pipe with a collection spout below the sander and my shop now stays really clean.
customer_reviews.author: michael m.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy with this guys performance
customer_reviews.text: Powerhouse. Extremely happy with this guys performance. Put a dust collector in the mix and save the filter bag from clogging.
customer_reviews.author: Noid

customer_reviews.title: Works great. A little quieter than a regular shop vac
customer_reviews.text: Works great. A little quieter than a regular shop vac. Arrived damaged. Looks like carrier was rough with it. Just a few scratches and chips. Still works fine.
customer_reviews.author: david w

customer_reviews.title: Quieter than my shop vac.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and hang up. has tremendous sucking power for the size and price
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Awesome dust collector for a small shop running a few pieces at a time. Definitely only one tool at a time for best collection.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Brophy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Using for my mitre saw. Going to order some smaller hose and use it for a floor sweep too
customer_reviews.author: angela ball

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for a small area
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is easy to mount to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Suction and noise
customer_reviews.text: I use this for 2 tools. Mitre saw and shop fox belt and disc sander. Performs very well. Plenty of suction minimal noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good dust collector
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I have it connected to 8 tools with blast gate.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: nice dust collector
customer_reviews.text: Well built, rugged, relatively quiet. A good dust collector for a small shop.
customer_reviews.author: John Yahn

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Works well, except some of the welds in the blower housing were shoddy
customer_reviews.author: Cat S

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Perfect for my small shop- Its not ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Perfect for my small shop- Its not very loud and its good for one tool at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Needles

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for several months now. The machine does a great job getting the dust out of the air. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Atilla Kocsis

customer_reviews.title: Item works great. Use it in a garage setting mainly for ...
customer_reviews.text: Item works great. Use it in a garage setting mainly for dust collection on a planer and table saw. I have one flexible hose attached to it with a quick connector attached to the hose. This allows me to quickly switch the hose between the saw and planer. All my equipment is on wheels and is put away after each project. I suppose this unit would be fine attached to both machines at once with a (Y) connection and separate hoses. I usually wear hearing protection, but even without it, this unit is not extremely loud. I also purchased a separate tube attachment to use it for vacuuming dust from the floor and it works great for that as well.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth. I love this thing. For the power it's quiet.
customer_reviews.author: SIXM6N

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. Easy to set up and hang. Perfect size for my small shop.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Yuma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works good. A little hard to pull around the room to vac.
customer_reviews.author: ARLINE

customer_reviews.title: A grate product it arrived yesterday got it installed and ...
customer_reviews.text: A grate product it arrived yesterday got it installed and connected with a Grizzly T26673 120V Dust Collection Remote and do's it work grate and it is quite running.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle man

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Hooked to my lathe and bandsaw with gates. Works great. Even gets the fine dust. I am well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: James Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very pleased with this unit. It is quiet at only 78db, (my garage with no tools running averages 50db), and it works well when connected to 1 tool at a time. I am not planning on piping this dust collector to multiple tools. I run the hose to whatever machine I am using but 90% of the time that is my table saw. I did use it on my planer and it collected probably 95% of the chips and dust on that. For a small shop it is great. It is much more pleasant than having my shopvac running all the time which is much louder.
customer_reviews.author: bkamplain

customer_reviews.title: works great for my little shop
customer_reviews.text: The install was very simple, works great for my little shop.
customer_reviews.author: Roland R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great Suction is good and it does the job
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: This is a good upgrade to my shop!
customer_reviews.text: This collector is working out great for me. I have it under the out feed table of my saw horizontally on a custom stand with the bag horizontal as well. It has more power than the Harbor Freight unit it replaced. It hardly leaves anything in the saw because it is very close. This is the same unit as the Dust Right from Rockler and it is less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the unit for about a month now and like some other people the shipping box was pretty beat up and the intake area was a little dented. That aside it is a very quite unit with decent suction power. It definitely does a good job for a small garage workshop that is limited on space.
customer_reviews.author: RANDY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great! quiter than my shop-vac with more suction. I have had this collector for almost a year and it works as good now as it did the day i received it. I use it a lot with my drum sander which requires emptying the bag more often. the fine sawdust tends to clog up the bag reducing the suction. I empty it when it gets about 1/4 full.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: box was in perfect condition but fan guard was damaged when i turned ...
customer_reviews.text: when it arrived, box was in perfect condition but fan guard was damaged when i turned it on it made a terrible noise, fan was hitting on the guard. didn't want to have to pack it back up so i took the guard off and pounded it back out, therefore all the paint fell off. second, the bag clamp is horrible, took 15 minutes to get it to stay on. although it works great if i had to do it all over i would buy from someone else.
customer_reviews.author: victor r. king

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great dust collector for the price. Keeps the floor clear and clutter free. Nice addition to my table saw and slow growing garage!
customer_reviews.author: Jason O.

customer_reviews.title: Booya...great machine
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice woodworker and this product is great for my garage shop. I'm running 3 machines and about 35 feet of 4 inch PVC and I little to no dust.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Spain

customer_reviews.title: Dust collection motor and bag by Shop Fox
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive unit, well engineered and performs exactly as advertised, at an economical price. Noise level perhaps a bit high during operation?
customer_reviews.author: frank chase

customer_reviews.title: Dust collector is not only very sufficient in collecting dust but very compact
customer_reviews.text: For a small shop situation this is the perfect solution to dust collecting provided you do not need a portable unit to move around to different locations. Somewhat noisy but not much different than other collectors with the same horsepower.
customer_reviews.author: StanS

customer_reviews.title: works well though and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, quite loud compared to our old one, works well though and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but really noisy
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but really noisy. I mean you need hearing protection just for this machine alone.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Trachtman

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed expectations! A heavy unit that will last. ...
customer_reviews.text: Surpassed expectations! A heavy unit that will last. Mounted it on the wall behind my radial arm saw. Unit is quieter than expected and gathers up all the dust the saw can generate.
customer_reviews.author: Donald C. Zamzow

customer_reviews.title: It took a hammer to fix never a good sign. Item does work as prescribed once it ...
customer_reviews.text: packaging inceficient, and had to modify right out of the box after speaking to the sales rep. It took a hammer to fix never a good sign. Item does work as prescribed once it was fixed and provides great suction with my sandblast cabinet
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Bag clogged with fine dust
customer_reviews.text: Within about 12 hours of use, the pours in the fabric collection bag had filled with sawdust and the suction was cut in half from what it was new (which wasn't all that strong to begin with.) This unit would be O.K. for machines producing chips/shavings, but it's poor for fine wood dust.
customer_reviews.author: P. Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: This is the best unit for the money and is working well, so far. I have decided to mount this unit horizonally with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Alton Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: weak performance, fan blade out of balance causing vibration...
customer_reviews.text: Fan blade was out of balance, wobbled, creating a vibration. Weak suction even with a 4‘‘ hose diameter. Quality of the unit as a whole was poor.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Slater

customer_reviews.title: So far this dust collector is doing great. It is much quieter than I thought and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this dust collector is doing great. It is much quieter than I thought and has great suction. I've used it a few time and am quite happy with it for the very reasonable price. It appears to be well made and was very easy to install on my wall.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Magnum

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the I-socket Autoswitch to go with ...
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you get the I-socket Autoswitch to go with it! this way when you turn on your chop saw/miter saw, the dust collector automatically kicks on.
customer_reviews.author: SheriLerm

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this item based on good reviews and based on cfm requirements of my sawstop ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item based on good reviews and based on cfm requirements of my sawstop tablesaw. I have this fox shop dust collector dedicated to the table saw no more than 4 feet away, I have been using this unit for two days and there is not even an ounce of dust in the dust bag. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Esteves

customer_reviews.title: Excellent power and suction
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power and suction. I've got two saws connected to it and it does a great job of sucking up all the sawdust. Easy to install. I highly recommend the shop fox.
customer_reviews.author: ArtyB

product_meta.title: Shop Fox W1826 Wall Dust Collector, 2.5 Micron Filtration
product_meta.description: Style:2.5 Micron Filter BagThis wall mounted Dust Collector is designed to capture dust right at the source, eliminating the reduced efficiency of a duct system. With 537 CFM capacity, it will handle just about any hungry woodworking machine, and with no complicated duct system, static pressure loss is minimal. A simple wall mounted bracket and locking screw system also ensures you'll be safely up and running in no time!
feature_bullets: 1-horsepower motor, 120 or 240V, prewired at 120V, 7 amp at 110V, 3.5 amp at 240V
Features window to gauge how much dust is in bag and bottom zipper for easy dust disposal
2.5 Micron bag has 2 cubic feet capacity

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars168 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
